text.0: agni refulgent among men thou slayest the devouring fiend.
text.1: bright ruler in thine own abode.
text.2: thou springest up when worshipped well the drops of butter are thy joy.
text.3: when ladies are brought near to thee.
text.4: honoured with gifts he shines afar agni adorable with song.
text.5: the dripping ladle balms his face.
text.6: agni with honey in his mouth honoured with gifts is balmed with oil.
text.7: refulgent in his wealth of light.
text.8: praised by our hymns thou kindlest thee oblationbearer for the gods.
text.9: as such do mortals call on thee.
text.10: to that immortal agni pay worship with oil ye mortal men.
text.11: lord of the house whom none deceives.
text.12: o agni burn the rākṣasas with thine unconquerable flame.
text.14: so agni with thy glowing face burn fierce against the female fiends.
text.16: uruksayas have kindled thee oblationbearer thee with hymns.
